required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Biomarkers of Angiogenesis and Disease in Patients With Unresectable Malignant Mesothelioma Treated on Clinical Trial CALGB-30107
clinical_study.official_title: Additional Circulating Markers of Angiogenesis and Disease in Mesothelioma Patients Treated on CALGB 30107

lead_sponsor.agency: Alliance for Clinical Trials in Oncology

clinical_study.source: Alliance for Clinical Trials in Oncology

brief_summary.textblock:
RATIONALE: Collecting and storing samples of blood from patients with cancer to study in the laboratory may help doctors learn more about cancer and identify biomarkers related to cancer.
PURPOSE: This laboratory study is looking at biomarkers of angiogenesis and disease in patients with unresectable malignant mesothelioma treated on clinical trial CALGB-30107.

detailed_description.textblock:
OBJECTIVES:
- Determine if elevated levels of thrombospondin I serum levels, vascular endothelial growth factor receptor I, fibroblast growth factor, transforming growth factor, and mesothelin portend a poor prognosis in patients with unresectable malignant mesothelioma treated with vatalanib on protocol CALGB-30107.
- Determine if elevated levels of thrombospondin I serum levels, vascular endothelial growth factor receptor I, fibroblast growth factor, transforming growth factor, and mesothelin correlate with response or stable disease in these patients.
OUTLINE: Serum samples previously obtained from patients on protocol CALGB-30107 are tested for levels of thrombospondin I serum, vascular endothelial growth factor receptor I, fibroblast growth factor, transforming growth factor, and mesothelin using enzyme-linked immunosorbent assays (ELISA).
PROJECTED ACCRUAL: A total of 47 specimens will be accrued for this study.

primary_outcome.measure: Level of biomarkers, including thrombospondin I, vascular endothelial growth factor receptor I, fibroblast growth factor, transforming growth factor, and mesothelin (high vs low)

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of biomarker expression level on overall survival

arm_group.description: Serum samples previously obtained from patients on protocol CALGB-30107 are tested for levels of thrombospondin I serum, vascular endothelial growth factor receptor I, fibroblast growth factor, transforming growth factor, and mesothelin using enzyme-linked immunosorbent assays (ELISA).

biospec_descr.textblock: Samples retained from patients participating on CALGB-30107.

study_pop.textblock: Patients previously enrolled on CALGB-30107 diagnosed with malignant mesothelioma.

criteria.textblock:
DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS:
- Diagnosis of malignant mesothelioma
- Unresectable disease
- Must have received treatment with vatalanib on protocol CALGB-30107
PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS:
- Not specified
PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY:
- See Disease Characteristics

overall_official.affiliation: Masonic Cancer Center, University of Minnesota
